episodes.title: Magic Xylophone
episodes.summary: As Bluey and Bingo begin to squabble over their magic xylophone (that has the power to freeze their Dad in space and time) Dad seizes control and freezes Bluey, leaving Bingo as her only hope.

episodes.title: Hospital
episodes.summary: Doctor Bluey is needed for assistance when Dad gets a very curious x-ray from Nurse Bingo. It seems that he has a cat in his tummy, leaving Bluey no choice but for her to operate immediately.

episodes.title: Keepy Uppy
episodes.summary: Bluey, Bingo and Mum are enjoying playing Keepy-Uppy around the house with their last balloon. All is fine, until their Dad joins in, and soon, the game becomes the ultimate test of skill.

episodes.title: Daddy Robot
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo don't want to tidy the playroom, so they get their Dad (as Daddy Robot) to do it for them. But when Bluey takes things too far, Daddy Robot begins to malfunction with some disastrous results.

episodes.title: Shadowlands
episodes.summary: On a picnic in the park, Bluey, Coco and Snickers play Shadowlands. But when Coco keeps taking shortcuts, Bluey has to show her that following the rules (and not changing them) can make the game even more fun.

episodes.title: The Weekend
episodes.summary: At the weekend, Bluey and Bingo are playing in the garden with their Dad. But Bingo gets upset, when she discovers a walking leaf insect and for her Dad, he is too caught up in the game to notice.

episodes.title: BBQ
episodes.summary: It's lunchtime on Bluey and her Dad's back decks. But every BBQ needs a side salad, so for Bingo, her relaxing sit-down will have to wait until she finds every color of capsicum that her cousins have asked for.

episodes.title: Fruitbat
episodes.summary: Not wanting to go to bed, Bluey tries to dream about being a nocturnal fruit bat so that she can stay up all night long, and soon, she finds herself flying through the night sky.

episodes.title: Horsey Ride
episodes.summary: When Bluey forgets to put her favorite toy away, Muffin's cousin Socks then grabs it and won't let go of it. The kids stage a horsey wedding to distract her, with Dad and Uncle Stripe as the horses.

episodes.title: Hotel
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo run a crazy "Hotel" with Dad as their first and only put upon guest. But when Bingo quits over Bluey being too controlling, their Dad needs to teach them the importance of compromise.

episodes.title: Bike
episodes.summary: One day at the park, Bluey is struggling to learn how to ride her own bike. But as she and her Dad watch her friends determination with their own tasks, Bluey is inspired to give it another try.

episodes.title: Bob Bilby
episodes.summary: When it's Bingo's turn to bring her Kindy's Bob Bilby puppet home and record their weekend in the scrapbook, the family resolve to put down their screens and attempt to show him a good time.

episodes.title: Spy Game
episodes.summary: When Bingo stops playing Bluey's spy game in the park, their device to control the grown-ups stops working properly. Bluey now sees how important Bingo is and she needs to win her back.

episodes.title: Takeaway
episodes.summary: While they are forced to wait five minutes in front of a restaurant for their takeaway order, Bluey and Bingo become restless for entertainment, pushing the very limits of Dad's patience.

episodes.title: Butterflies
episodes.summary: Playing 'Butterflies' in the backyard is great fun. The game goes on, until Bluey runs away with Judo, leaving Bingo all alone. Now poor Bingo's heartbroken, and for Bluey, she needs to make amends.

episodes.title: Yoga Ball
episodes.summary: For Bingo, she loves horsing around with her Dad, but sometimes he forgets that Bingo is smaller than her sister. Mum teaches Bingo how to use her big girl bark to keep their fun within her limits.

episodes.title: Calypso
episodes.summary: At school, Bluey and her friends all throw themselves into various games. Their teacher Calypso keeps her charges on track with a wise word and a song - all except for the mysterious Pretzel.

episodes.title: The Doctor
episodes.summary: Honey is stuck waiting for Dr Bingo's appointment as all the other, more exciting injuries get seen before her's. Receptionist Bluey tells her to be patient, as some of these cases are a real pickle.

episodes.title: The Claw
episodes.summary: When Bluey and Bingo are unable to grab some chocolate doodads on a Magic Claw machine, they both return back to their house. Mum and Dad create their own version at home. But for Dad, he isn't about to make winning easy.

episodes.title: Markets
episodes.summary: When Bluey visits the markets with five dollars from the tooth fairy, the options for her are endless. But as she and Indy scour the market stalls for the perfect purchase, spending it proves hard.

episodes.title: Blue Mountains
episodes.summary: Bluey, Bingo, Mum and Dad all play a game of hand puppets, exploring the land beyond the Blue Mountains where they'll have to outsmart the Cheeky Fox to find the softest beds in the world.

episodes.title: The Pool
episodes.summary: While packing for the pool, Bluey and her Dad tease Mum about being so fussy with what to take, But when they arrive under prepared, they realize that a little planning goes a long way.

episodes.title: Shops
episodes.summary: Playing 'Shops' is the best game ever for Bluey and her friends - if they can only ever get started. With Bluey questioning the rules and changing who's who, they might be here all day.

episodes.title: Wagon Ride
episodes.summary: Bluey can't wait to get to the monkey bars as Dad takes her and Bingo on a wagon ride to the park. But her patience will be tested when Dad keeps stopping to chat with other grown-ups.

episodes.title: Taxi
episodes.summary: Bluey is running a taxi service. Her first passenger is Dad taking the role of the Businessman, who is in a rush to get to the airport. But with unexpected delays, Dad's in danger of missing his own flight.

episodes.title: The Beach
episodes.summary: As her Mum goes for a walk along the beach, Bluey runs to catch up with her. Along the way, she has a series of encounters that will both excite and test her in her first solo adventure.

episodes.title: Pirates
episodes.summary: It's an adventure on the high seas as Bluey, Bingo and Missy play Pirates on the hammock swing, but they'll need to find their courage to withstand storms and whale attacks.

episodes.title: Grannies
episodes.summary: A game of 'Grannies' is fun, until Bingo and Bluey can't agree on one simple question: Can Grannies dance? Now they'll need to video call their Nana to get the answer.

episodes.title: The Creek
episodes.summary: Bored of the local playground, Dad and the kids go out on a journey to their local creek. Cast out of her comfort zone, Bluey's eyes are opened to the beauty of the natural world.

episodes.title: Fairies
episodes.summary: Bluey's house has fairies. Tails are being braided, stickers are everywhere, and Mum's got a peg beard. Now the family must band together to hunt for these invisible mischief-makers.

episodes.title: Work
episodes.summary: In a game of 'Work', Dad hires Bluey and Bingo at his drainpipe factory. But when Bluey gets to take charge, Dad finds his new boss pretty tough, especially her no dancing rule.

episodes.title: Bumpy and the Wise Old Wolfhound
episodes.summary: Bingo is sick in hospital, so Bluey and her Dad make, and send her a homemade video to lift her spirits. It tells the tale of Barnicus' quest to heal her spotty dog named Bumpy.

episodes.title: Trampoline
episodes.summary: When Dad has to stop having fun with the girls and go to work, Bluey and Bingo scramble to keep him playing games with them on the trampoline at the same time.

episodes.title: The Dump
episodes.summary: On a trip to the Dump Dad claims he's the best at everything. But Bluey discovers that Dad's throwing out her old drawing and questions if he really is the best Dad in the world.

episodes.title: Zoo
episodes.summary: Bluey's backyard zoo is home to wonderful animals, especially the big blue Daddy gorilla. But when he grabs visitor Bingo and escapes, Zookeeper Bluey must recapture the wild beast.

episodes.title: Backpackers
episodes.summary: Mum and Dad are going on an adventure for the day, wearing the kids as their cheeky backpacks. Seeing the sights and buying street food, backpacking is a blast - until they lose their passports.

episodes.title: The Adventure
episodes.summary: Bluey plays with Chloe and pretends to be a horse as she accompanies the princess on an imaginary adventure to find food at the family farm. The friends swap roles and adopt a variety of personas as they save the kingdom from an evil queen

episodes.title: Copycat
episodes.summary: Bluey's having fun copying everything Dad says and does, but the game takes a serious turn when Bluey finds a hurt budgie and they have to make an emergency trip to the vet.

episodes.title: The Sleepover
episodes.summary: A sleepover with their cousin Muffin means Bluey and Bingo get to stay up late. But when Muffin shows up exhausted after missing her nap, the girls get more fun than they bargained for.

episodes.title: Early Baby
episodes.summary: Bluey's playgroup is at odds when Indy's baby hospital collides with Rusty's knights and dragons. But in explaining themselves, they both find that their games actually have a lot in common.

episodes.title: Mums and Dads
episodes.summary: While playing a game of Mum and Dads, Rusty and Indy couldn't decide who should "go to work" or "stay and take care of the infant" which causes them to split and play with other children.

episodes.title: Hide and Seek
episodes.summary: It's time for a family game of hide and seek. Everyone hides, while Bluey counts to twenty, but will she be able to stay focused on the game and not get distracted by all her toys.

episodes.title: Camping
episodes.summary: While on a camping holiday, Bluey makes a new friend called Jean-Luc. Bluey may not understand him, but they find common language playing and hunting for a wild Daddy pig.

episodes.title: Mount Mumandad
episodes.summary: Bingo and Bluey have five minutes to bed, just enough time to race to the summit of Mount Mumandad. But for them, facing powerful storms, avalanches and stinky spots will take teamwork.

episodes.title: Kids
episodes.summary: A quick trip to the shops proves tricky for Dad, when Bingo and Bluey want to play a game of 'Kids'. Now Bluey is Mum, Bingo's her baby and for Dad however, he is a very naughty boy.

episodes.title: Chickenrat
episodes.summary: It's bedtime and Bingo can't remember where she left her beloved Floppy. Retracing their steps, Bingo and Bluey lead their Mum through their bizarre day in the hope of tracking her down.

episodes.title: Neighbours
episodes.summary: Bluey needs her Mum's advice on dealing with a troublesome neighbor, when the serenity of her couch cushion playhouse is threatened by Bingo's own growing stable of animals.

episodes.title: Teasing
episodes.summary: Bluey, Bingo and Mum get into a debate with Dad about the definition of teasing. As they recall all the times where he's been a Big Teaser, Dad argues that he was only just playing.

episodes.title: Asparagus
episodes.summary: Dad tells Bluey to mind her manners at the table - they're not animals. But when Bluey gets her hands on a stick of magic asparagus, she shows them everyone's got a wild side.

episodes.title: Shaun
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo want a pet. To show them how much work they'd be in for, Dad gets to transform his hand into their old friend Shaun, a chaotic, undisciplined Emu with a taste for trouble.

episodes.title: Daddy Putdown
episodes.summary: When Mum goes out to a baby shower, Dad takes charge of the girls' evening routine. But with Bluey missing Mum, Dad has to pull out all the games he knows to keep them entertained.

episodes.title: Verandah Santa
episodes.summary: It's Christmas Eve and Dad and the kids are taking turns pretending to be Santa. But when Socks nips Bluey, and she refuses to leave her a present, they must all learn the true meaning of being good for Christmas.

episodes.title: Dance Mode
episodes.summary: After Dad eats her last chip, Bingo is given three chances to put Mum and Dad in "Dance Mode" as payback. But the others can't resist taking Bingo's turns for her.

episodes.title: Hammerbarn
episodes.summary: On a trip to Hammerbarn, Bluey and Bingo create their own mini-homes side-by-side in the trolley. But Bluey quickly gets jealous of her neighbour, Bingo.

episodes.title: Featherwand
episodes.summary: Bluey and Mum are off to Chloe's party and Bingo isn't invited. But armed with a magic featherwand that makes things incredibly heavy, Bingo can now stop them leaving the house.

episodes.title: Squash
episodes.summary: When dad and Uncle Stripe play a game of squash, Bluey and Bingo are in control of their every move, and Bingo proves that big siblings don't always beat little siblings.

episodes.title: Hairdressers
episodes.summary: During a game of hairdressers, Bluey discovers that big-headed customer Dad has nits. To help treat them Bingo has to find her voice, while Bluey has to find her ears.

episodes.title: Stumpfest
episodes.summary: Dad and his mates hit the backyard, ready to rip up some tree stumps. But when Bluey and Bingo take over a stump as a nail salon, Dad finds he's got some negotiating to do.

episodes.title: Favourite Thing
episodes.summary: When Bluey accidentally makes Bingo upset playing a game at dinner, she will do anything to make her happy again - even changing the rules of the game. But nothing seems to work.

episodes.title: Daddy Dropoff
episodes.summary: Dad refuses to be late dropping off Bluey and Bingo at kindy and school, but the girls make Dad play so many games, they quickly derail his plan.

episodes.title: Bingo
episodes.summary: When Bluey has a playdate at Chloe's, Bingo must learn how to play by herself. But all the games she knows need more than one person. Luckily Dad has a problem that needs solving.

episodes.title: Rug Island
episodes.summary: On Bingo and Bluey's Rug Island, a pack of felt pens can be anything: bananas, campfires, even a snake. But Dad will need to embrace his inner kid if he wants to make it his home.

episodes.title: Charades
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo want everyone to play charades, but Muffin and Socks are too young to understand the rules and Nana must think quickly to keep the game on track.

episodes.title: Sticky Gecko
episodes.summary: Chilli is taking Bluey and Bingo to the park to play with Judo, but they can't leave before they finish their game - waiting for a sticky rubber gecko to drop from the ceiling.

episodes.title: Dad Baby
episodes.summary: When Dad shows the kids how to use their old baby-harness, a new game is born: Dad Baby. But dad is unprepared for the harsh realities of giving birth to a baby Bingo.

episodes.title: Mum School
episodes.summary: Bluey plays mum to a brood of bouncy balloons, including an irrepressible floater named Greenie. But she soon discovers that mothering is much harder than she imagined.

episodes.title: Trains
episodes.summary: All aboard the Dad Train. Bingo goes from home to daycare to her job at the vet every morning, but there's trouble on the line as a mischievous Bluey throws everyone off schedule.

episodes.title: Army
episodes.summary: Jack is the new dog at school and the newest recruit in Rusty's Army. Jack struggles with following instructions and always forgets his hat, but Rusty will make a soldier of him yet.

episodes.title: Fancy Restaurant
episodes.summary: Bingo and Bluey want mum and dad to smoochy kiss, so they set up a romantic evening for two at their fancy restaurant. Everything goes to plan, until chef Bingo's special arrives.

episodes.title: Piggyback
episodes.summary: The Heelers take a long riverside walk, but Bingo's legs are tired, and she wants a piggyback. To distract her, mum and dad invent fun games and get her little legs moving again.

episodes.title: The Show
episodes.summary: When Bingo drops Mum's breakfast-in-bed on the floor, she's convinced she's ruined her big day. But Bluey helps make amends by putting on a play of how Mum and Dad first met.

episodes.title: Tickle Crabs
episodes.summary: When Dad brings a pair of tenacious tickle crabs home from the beach, nowhere in the house is safe. His only hope of escaping their tickles is with help from his true love.

episodes.title: Escape
episodes.summary: When Mum and Dad describe a made-up world where they can relax without the girls, Bluey and Bingo decide to burst into their fantasy and chase them down. How will Mum and Dad escape?

episodes.title: Bus
episodes.summary: During a game of bus, passenger Mum is too scared to tell bus driver Dad that she secretly loves him, until she gets some help from the Grannies

episodes.title: Queens
episodes.summary: During a game of Queens, Bluey and Bingo find that playing the butler is much more fun. But someone must play the queen, even if it means not being afraid of a bit of hard work.

episodes.title: Flat Pack
episodes.summary: While Mum and Dad struggle to build new flat-pack furniture, Bluey and Bingo transform the empty boxes into their own new world.

episodes.title: Helicopter
episodes.summary: At school, Bluey and her friends turn a tree stump into a thrilling game of Helicopter. But as the pilot, Bluey has to learn to give up some control, so they can all have fun.

episodes.title: Sleepytime
episodes.summary: Inside Bingo's dream, Bingo and Floppy have an intergalactic adventure, while the rest of her sleep-deprived family try to navigate Bingo's non-stop night-time bedhopping.

episodes.title: Grandad
episodes.summary: Grandad is supposed to be resting, but when Bluey and Bingo go to visit him, he makes a run for it with the kids and takes them on a madcap adventure into the bush.

episodes.title: Seesaw
episodes.summary: Dad has rudely plonked himself on one end of the seesaw. So Bluey and Bingo round up the entire playground to help flip him off, but they still need to find one more friend.

episodes.title: Movies
episodes.summary: It is Bluey's first trip to the cinema, but she's worried that the movie will be too scary. When Bingo starts running amok in the theatre, she must conquer her fear and help Dad out.

episodes.title: Library
episodes.summary: When Muffin is told that she is special by her Dad, she interprets it as an excuse to do anything she wants, which means playing Bluey and Bingo's game of Library her way.

episodes.title: Barky Boats
episodes.summary: Bluey and Mackenzie are excited to spend time with their two buddies Mia and Captain. When the older kids run off to play together without them, Calypso explains that growing up can be hard.

episodes.title: Burger Shop
episodes.summary: It's time for Bluey and Bingo to get out of the bath. But Dad has decided not to tell them what to do and gets roped into a game of Burger Shop.

episodes.title: Circus
episodes.summary: Bluey is the ringmaster in a game of circus with her friends, but Hercules wants to play his motorcycle game instead. Luckily Bluey has a solution to keep everyone happy.

episodes.title: Swim School
episodes.summary: Mum, Dad and Bingo must complete both their classes to pass Swim School but pleasing strict Big Fish instructor Margaret (aka Bluey) is proving very difficult.

episodes.title: Cafe
episodes.summary: In the park Bluey meets a new playmate Winnie, but when Bluey wants to invite her and her dad home for breakfast, she learns that adults take a little bit longer to make friends.

episodes.title: Postman
episodes.summary: When Mum and Dad have a disagreement, Bluey makes Dad write a love letter to Mum to make up. Now Bluey must find a way to play Ground's Lava with Bingo and deliver the letter to Mum, without squabbling.

episodes.title: The Quiet Game
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo are playing The Quiet Game and won't use words to tell Dad which toy to buy for Muffin. At his wit's end, Dad recruits new store clerk Alfie to help interpret the girls' miming.

episodes.title: Mr Monkeyjocks
episodes.summary: Dad thinks the kids have too many toys and suggests a chuck out. To save their beloved Mr Monkeyjocks from getting the chop, Bluey and Bingo must prove he is special.

episodes.title: Double Babysitter
episodes.summary: When Uncle Rad and Frisky accidentally turn up to babysit Bluey and Bingo on the same night, they have to work together to make Bluey feel better about babysitter put-downs.

episodes.title: Bad Mood
episodes.summary: Bingo is playing 'Bad Mood' with Dad, standing on his feet as Dad stomps around the house, controlling everything Bingo does and causing chaos. But how will Bluey get her to snap out of it?

episodes.title: Octopus
episodes.summary: When Chloe tries to teach her dad to improvise and play Bluey's game of Octopus, he finds it hard to understand or enjoy, until they both realise they can play it their own way.

episodes.title: Bin Night
episodes.summary: Bluey, Bingo and Dad always take the bins out. Over a few weeks, Bingo tells dad about a new kid at kindy who is mean to her and Mum offers some good advice.

episodes.title: Muffin Cone
episodes.summary: When Muffin can't stop sucking her thumb, she has to start wearing a cone of shame. But the cone gets in her way and can no longer play 'sandwich shop' with Bluey and Bingo.

episodes.title: Duck Cake
episodes.summary: Bluey wants to help make Bingo's birthday cake but first must put away her toys. But nothing can tempt her to clean up until Dad drops the cake.

episodes.title: Handstand
episodes.summary: At a party, Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills, while Nanna can't find a way to make herself useful. They're both feelings bit lost, until they find each other.

episodes.title: Road Trip
episodes.summary: Mum helps Bluey and Bingo find ways to entertain themselves on a family road trip, while dad tries to stay ahead of the grey nomad convoy or risk camping near the toilets.

episodes.title: Ice Cream
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo want a lick of each other's ice cream, but they are so focused on making sure each lick is fair, they don't notice their ice creams are melting.

episodes.title: Dunny
episodes.summary: Mum bans the girls from saying the word 'dunny' because it's not a word The Queen would use, but the kids try and trick her into saying it anyway.

episodes.title: Typewriter
episodes.summary: Bluey, Snickers and Winton are on their way to ask Calypso for help with their problems, when they are ambushed by the Terriers and use their unique talents to get past.

episodes.title: Baby Race
episodes.summary: Mum reminisces about Bluey and Judo as babies. Bluey learnt to roll over first, but Judo was the first to crawl, so then it became a race to see who would walk first.

episodes.title: Christmas Swim
episodes.summary: The Heelers gather for a classic Aussie Christmas, Bluey gets a new teddy and introduces him to the whole family. But the family play too rough with him and now he wants to go home. Until Frisky convinces him to stay.

episodes.title: Easter
episodes.summary: Bingo is convinced the Easter Bunny has forgotten them like last year, until Bluey finds a series of clues that leads them on an Easter egg treasure hunt.

episodes.title: Perfect
episodes.summary: Bluey wants to draw the perfect Father's Day card by remembering fun games she's played with Dad, but starts to get frustrated when she finds a problem with each drawing. None of them are perfect enough.

episodes.title: Bedroom
episodes.summary: Bluey is excited to get her own room. But when bed time comes, she misses Bingo more than she expected and must find a way to stay in touch with her sister.

episodes.title: Obstacle Course
episodes.summary: Mum sets up a backyard obstacle course just for fun, but Dad wants to race. Now the kids are determined to win by any means necessary.

episodes.title: Promises
episodes.summary: Bluey keeps breaking her promises. But after seeing how much Bingo trusts Mum's word, Bluey learns the power of promises and why it's important not to break them.

episodes.title: Omelette
episodes.summary: Bingo is helping Mum make an omelette for Dad's birthday breakfast, but cracking eggs is harder than it looks and Dad is getting hungrier by the minute.

episodes.title: Born Yesterday
episodes.summary: When Dad pretends he was born yesterday, Bluey and Bingo have to guide him through his second day on Earth, especially when he discovers food is delicious and steals Lucky Dad's pie.

episodes.title: Mini Bluey
episodes.summary: When Dad complains about how dissimilar Bluey and Bingo are, Bluey hatches a plan to make them more alike and happily introduces Mini-Bluey.

episodes.title: Unicorse
episodes.summary: Bluey can't get to sleep, so Mum reads her one last story. But they are interrupted by Unicorse, the most annoying hand puppet in the world, who Bluey tries to reform.

episodes.title: Curry Quest
episodes.summary: Bingo and Dad must brave a swooping magpie protecting its nest when they go on a curry swap to Mackenzie's house through the park.

episodes.title: Magic
episodes.summary: Bluey teaches Bingo how to use magic so she can make Mum play with her, but she forgets to explain the most important rule - never use magic for cheekiness.

episodes.title: Chest
episodes.summary: Dad tries to teach Bluey how to play chess, but Mum thinks she is still too young. When Bingo joins in, the kids make up their own rules, but they still can't beat Dad.

episodes.title: Sheep Dog
episodes.summary: Dad agrees to play Sheepdog with Bluey and Bingo to stop them from disturbing Mum who is taking a well-earned rest. But looking after a sheep is harder work than they expected.

episodes.title: Housework
episodes.summary: Mum and Dad vow to only finish their boring housework when the kids stop acting silly, but that's never going to happen, so they end up trying the same approach themselves.

episodes.title: Pass The Parcel
episodes.summary: Lucky's Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle, but Bingo is forever losing.

episodes.title: Explorers
episodes.summary: While waiting to be picked up from school, Jack plays at being a sailor trying to find his way back home to Australia. Meanwhile, Jack's Dad has got lost en route to collect him.

episodes.title: Phones
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo want to play restaurants with Grandad, but it's a little different than he's used to - he's going to need an app to order the food.

episodes.title: Pavlova
episodes.summary: Mum won't let Bingo have Pavlova, so the kids find a way by playing a cheeky game of Cafe in the kitchen. But Dad the chef sets up a competing shop that only serves edamame beans.

episodes.title: Rain
episodes.summary: When a heavy summer rain thunders over the Heeler home, Bluey is determined to dam the water in the front yard, while Mum tries to stop her constantly tracking mud into the house.

episodes.title: Pizza Girls
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo are making mud pizzas and delivering them to the grownups, but their pedal car's wheel keeps falling off.

episodes.title: Driving
episodes.summary: With only five minutes to play 'Driving', Bluey and Mum race against the clock to buy milk for a grumpy guest and have to escape an angry shopkeeper.

episodes.title: Tina
episodes.summary: Tired of being told what to do, Bluey and Bingo enlist their giant invisible friend to show Mum and Dad who's boss. Now they can do anything they want, until Mum and Dad rebel.

episodes.title: Whale Watching
episodes.summary: Bluey promises her customer Bingo 'the best tour ever' in a game of Whale Watching, but they need Mum and Dad to join in and they are too tired to play after a late night.

episodes.title: Family Meeting
episodes.summary: When Dad's accused of 'fluffing' in Bluey's face as he climbed out of bed, he's put on trial with Mum as the judge and Bluey and Bingo as witnesses. But what was Bluey doing there?

episodes.title: Faceytalk
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo love to video chat with Muffin and Socks so they can all draw pictures together. When Muffin won't give Socks a turn, the kids discover what happens when you hog.

episodes.title: Ragdoll
episodes.summary: Dad agrees to take Bluey and Bingo to the shops to buy an ice-cream if they can get him into the car. Only problem is - he's just entered 'Ragdoll' mode.

episodes.title: Fairytale
episodes.summary: Dad tells Bluey and Bingo a real-life fairy tale about growing up in a wild place called the 80s, about a boy who was cursed when he was mean to his little brother.

episodes.title: Musical Statues
episodes.summary: At the end of a long day, Bluey and her family are out of sync and out of sorts, so Mum gets everyone to play musical statues.

episodes.title: Stories
episodes.summary: Indy thinks she's no good because her model horse looks like a cow, but Calypso encourages her not to give up, so she tries to fix it with a little help from Winton.

episodes.title: Puppets
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo teach Unicorse good manners so he can ask Mum on a date, but things go awry when Unicorse eats a tick.

episodes.title: Turtleboy
episodes.summary: Bingo finds a toy turtle at the playground and wants to take him home, but Dad says it's not the done thing.

episodes.title: Onesies
episodes.summary: When Mum's sister Brandy comes over for a visit, she brings the kids onesies as a present, which has an unexpected effect on Bingo.

episodes.title: Tradies
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo hide under the house and spy on two mysterious tradies working in the backyard.

episodes.title: Granny Mobile
episodes.summary: Muffin is playing Grouchy Granny at a garage sale, making Dad push her on an old mobility scooter. But when a real Grouchy Granny wants to buy it, Muffin won't budge.

episodes.title: Space
episodes.summary: Mackenzie, Jack and Rusty are playing as astronauts on a mission to Mars. But during their journey, Mackenzie keeps going missing and no one knows why, not even Mackenzie.

episodes.title: Smoochy Kiss
episodes.summary: Bluey and Bingo want Dad all to themselves until they discover he has some gross habits.

episodes.title: Dirt
episodes.summary: Judo wants to play in the dirt with Bluey and Bingo, but she's not supposed to get dirty.

episodes.title: The Decider
episodes.summary: The Heelers and Lucky's family get together to watch the big game.

episodes.title: Episode #3.38
